titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the James Thomas Watkins Papers, 1927-1970
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Brooke Dykman Dockter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-06-27T16:10-0700

change.item: June 27, 2016: Revised to add description of microfilm reels and add to extent after microfilm cabinet inventory August 13, 2012: Revised to update encoding by Jill Golden March 15, 2010: Edited to add framed painting; March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::James Thomas Watkins Papers)//EN" "watkinj.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 25 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 2 envelopes, 6 microfilm reels, 1 phonorecord, 1 framed painting

did.abstract: Writings, reports, memoranda, orders, correspondence, printed matter, and photographs, relating to American military administration of Okinawa immediately after World War II. Entire collection also on microfilm (36 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Thomas Watkins Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1971.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American political scientist; lieutenant commander, United States Navy; political affairs officer, United States Military Government, Okinawa, 1945-1946.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, reports, memoranda, orders, correspondence, printed matter, and photographs, relating to American military administration of Okinawa immediately after World War II. Entire collection also on microfilm (36 reels).

did.unittitle: Evacuation, resettlement, home life, orphanages, and rationing - photographs
Clippings of early occupation of Okinawa,
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa, monthly reports
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa, team history reports,
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa - special documents,
Okinawa - miscellaneous printed matter, student papers, and letters
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa - post office and censorship
Chronology of U.S. Military Government, Okinawa
Pre-occupation training of military government officers
Morgan memoir on occupation of Okinawa
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa, minutes of meetings,
U.S. Military Government, Okinawa - planning phase
U.S. 10th Army Military Government planning history
U.S. Army assumption of military government,
Enlisted personnel - guard lists and plans of the day
Hanna memoir on military government planning stage
Hanna/Watkins manuscript on land and people of Okinawa
Okinawa Advisory Council - notes on meetings with U.S. Military Government Political Affairs Officer
Government up to rejection of Murdock Plan
Notes of meetings with Chiji and Cabinet
Watkins manuscript on Okinawa government - first draft
Watkins revision of Lawrence thesis on public health
Lessons from experience - notes and correspondence
Correspondence with military government enlisted personnel,
Lawrence, William Henry, Jr., "Military Government in Okinawa: Disaster Relief Administration, the Economy and Its Rehabilitation, and Supply," M.A. thesis, Columbia University,
Miscellaneous mimeographed reports, photographs and printed matter, relating to Okinawa,
U.S. Navy Civil Affairs Handbook for Ryukyus,
Nakasone, Genwa, "From Okinawa to Ryukyu" (in Japanese)
Chit book of Charles W. Ure, businessman in Shanghai,
Maps, printed matter and miscellany, relating to Japan and world politics,
Reports of U.S. Foreign Service oral examination of Stanford University students,
Correspondence, student papers, printed matter and miscellany, relating to world government and U.S. and world politics,
Press releases and printed matter, relating to the attitudes of various member nations of the United Nations toward the Korean War,
Watkins Family genealogy on 4 x 6 cards
Administration of Occupied Areas, a study guide by Philip H. Taylor and Ralph J. D. Braibanti, Syracuse University Press, pamphlet
Watkins manuscript and notes on early occupation period
Ryukyu Islands, a bibliography, Department of the Army pamphlet,
Lt. Commander Paul H. Skuse's letters to his wife from Okinawa
Navy School of Military Government (class notes)
Watkins letters from Okinawa to wife and family
Correspondence with Sanford Zalburg and Arnold Fisch
Printed matter on the occupation of Japan, and the League of Nations
Button given to the delegates of the World Youth Congress held in Geneva in 1936

1 framed oil painting, 1946, by Japanese artist O-shiro Ko-ya, depicting a scene at Shikiya with Kudaka Island in the distance, commissioned by the officers and men of the U.S. Naval Military Government
Microfilm reels of Okinawan Papers Deposited by Professor John T. Watkins in the Hoover Institution
